message:
SYSTEM: 03_OWL.pdf: Página 9
© O. Corcho, MC Suárez de Figueroa Baonza
9
OWL and SWRL
Most common axioms in class, property and individual 
definitions
•
Classes
–
Subclass
C1 C2
Human Animal Biped
–
Equivalence
C1 C2
Man Human Male
–
Disjointness
C1 C2 ⊥
Male Female ⊥
•
Properties/roles
–
Subproperty
P1 P2
hasDaughter hasChild
–
Equivalence
P1 P2
cost price
–
Inverse
P1 P2-
hasChild hasParent-
–
Transitive
P+ P
ancestor+ ancestor
–
Functional
1P
T 1hasMother
–
InverseFunctional
1P-
T 1hasPassportID-
•
Individuals
–
Equivalence
{x1} {x2}
{oeg:OscarCorcho} {img:Oscar}
–
Different
{x1} {x2}
{john} {peter}
•
Most axioms are reducible to inclusion ()
–
C D iff both C D and D C
–
C disjoint D iff C ¬D
speaker: SYSTEM
